page.title: 12FARMING DARTMOOR
page.content: Farmers no longer keep pigs for salted and smoked meat.They use more convenience foods.They keep chicken for eggs and cats and dogs for pets. The women worked hard at hay- making and harvest time.When they made hay ricks they thatched them with rushes tied with hay ropes which they had twisted.Now machines bale the hay and combine harvesters process the wheat.They used to work from 6a.m.to 10p.m.but machinery has made life easier.During {World War Two}and before horses were used for pulling carts and ploughs.Horses were shod at Ashburton or Widecombe.After the war tractors replaced horses.The smithy and carpenter's shop at {Buckland}used to provide gatehangings,wheelbarrows and tools but they are now private homes as is the schoolroom.Children go to Widecombe or Ashburton schools now.
